intro: Argostemma buwaldae, commonly known as the Himalayan arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a valuable subject for ecological and horticultural study.
